trans-unit.source: Use Azure Machine Learning with SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Azure Machine Learning with SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Tutorial for using Azure Machine Learning with Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.
trans-unit.target: Tutorial for using Azure Machine Learning with Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.

trans-unit.source: Use Azure Machine Learning with SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: Use Azure Machine Learning with SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning is a fully managed predictive analytics service that you can use to create predictive models against your data in SQL Data Warehouse, and publish them as ready-to-consume web services.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning is a fully managed predictive analytics service that you can use to create predictive models against your data in SQL Data Warehouse, and publish them as ready-to-consume web services.

trans-unit.source: You can learn the basics of predictive analytics and machine learning by reading [Introduction to Machine Learning on Azure][].
trans-unit.target: You can learn the basics of predictive analytics and machine learning by reading [Introduction to Machine Learning on Azure][].

trans-unit.source: You can then learn how to create, train, score and test a machine learning model using the [Create experiment tutorial][].
trans-unit.target: You can then learn how to create, train, score and test a machine learning model using the [Create experiment tutorial][].

trans-unit.source: In this article, you will learn how to do the following using the [Azure Machine Learning Studio][]:
trans-unit.target: In this article, you will learn how to do the following using the [Azure Machine Learning Studio][]:

trans-unit.source: Read data from your database to create, train and score a predictive model
trans-unit.target: Read data from your database to create, train and score a predictive model

trans-unit.source: Write data to your database
trans-unit.target: Write data to your database

trans-unit.source: Read data from SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: Read data from SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: We will read data from Product table in the AdventureWorksDW database.
trans-unit.target: We will read data from Product table in the AdventureWorksDW database.

trans-unit.source: Step 1
trans-unit.target: Step 1

trans-unit.source: Start a new experiment by clicking +NEW at the bottom of the Machine Learning Studio window, select EXPERIMENT, and then select Blank Experiment.
trans-unit.target: Start a new experiment by clicking +NEW at the bottom of the Machine Learning Studio window, select EXPERIMENT, and then select Blank Experiment.

trans-unit.source: Select the default experiment name at the top of the canvas and rename it to something meaningful, for example, Bicycle price prediction.
trans-unit.target: Select the default experiment name at the top of the canvas and rename it to something meaningful, for example, Bicycle price prediction.

trans-unit.source: Step 2
trans-unit.target: Step 2

trans-unit.source: Look for the Reader module in the palette of datasets and modules on the left of the experiment canvas.
trans-unit.target: Look for the Reader module in the palette of datasets and modules on the left of the experiment canvas.

trans-unit.source: Drag the module to the experiment canvas.
trans-unit.target: Drag the module to the experiment canvas.

trans-unit.source: ![][drag_reader]
trans-unit.target: ![][drag_reader]

trans-unit.source: Step 3
trans-unit.target: Step 3

trans-unit.source: Select the Reader module and fill out the properties pane
trans-unit.target: Select the Reader module and fill out the properties pane

trans-unit.source: Select Azure SQL Database as the Data Source
trans-unit.target: Select Azure SQL Database as the Data Source

trans-unit.source: Database server name: Type the server name.
trans-unit.target: Database server name: Type the server name.

trans-unit.source: You can use the [Azure Portal][] to find this.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [Azure Portal][] to find this.

trans-unit.source: ![][server_name]
trans-unit.target: ![][server_name]

trans-unit.source: Database name: Type the name of a database on the server you just specified.
trans-unit.target: Database name: Type the name of a database on the server you just specified.

trans-unit.source: Server user account name: Type the user name of an account that has access permissions for the database.
trans-unit.target: Server user account name: Type the user name of an account that has access permissions for the database.

trans-unit.source: Server user account password: Provide the password for the specified user account.
trans-unit.target: Server user account password: Provide the password for the specified user account.

trans-unit.source: Accept any server certificate: Use this option (less secure) if you want to skip reviewing the site certificate before you read your data.
trans-unit.target: Accept any server certificate: Use this option (less secure) if you want to skip reviewing the site certificate before you read your data.

trans-unit.source: Database query: Enter a SQL statement that describes the data you want to read.
trans-unit.target: Database query: Enter a SQL statement that describes the data you want to read.

trans-unit.source: In this case, we’ll read data from Product table using the following query.
trans-unit.target: In this case, we’ll read data from Product table using the following query.

trans-unit.source: ![][reader_properties]
trans-unit.target: ![][reader_properties]

trans-unit.source: Step 4
trans-unit.target: Step 4

trans-unit.source: Run the experiment by clicking Run under the experiment canvas.
trans-unit.target: Run the experiment by clicking Run under the experiment canvas.

trans-unit.source: When the experiment finishes, the Reader module will have a green check mark to indicate that it has completed successfully.
trans-unit.target: When the experiment finishes, the Reader module will have a green check mark to indicate that it has completed successfully.

trans-unit.source: Notice also the Finished running status in the upper-right corner.
trans-unit.target: Notice also the Finished running status in the upper-right corner.

trans-unit.source: To see the imported data, click the output port at the bottom of the automobile dataset and select Visualize.
trans-unit.target: To see the imported data, click the output port at the bottom of the automobile dataset and select Visualize.

trans-unit.source: Create, train and score a model
trans-unit.target: Create, train and score a model

trans-unit.source: Now you can use this dataset to:
trans-unit.target: Now you can use this dataset to:

trans-unit.source: Create a Model: Process data and define features
trans-unit.target: Create a Model: Process data and define features

trans-unit.source: Train the model: Choose and apply a learning algorithm
trans-unit.target: Train the model: Choose and apply a learning algorithm

trans-unit.source: Score and test the model: Predict new bicycle price
trans-unit.target: Score and test the model: Predict new bicycle price

trans-unit.source: ![][model]
trans-unit.target: ![][model]

trans-unit.source: To learn more about how to create, train, score and test a machine learning model use the [Create experiment tutorial][].
trans-unit.target: To learn more about how to create, train, score and test a machine learning model use the [Create experiment tutorial][].

trans-unit.source: Write data to Azure SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: Write data to Azure SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: We will write the result set to ProductPriceForecast table in the AdventureWorksDW database.
trans-unit.target: We will write the result set to ProductPriceForecast table in the AdventureWorksDW database.

trans-unit.source: Step 1
trans-unit.target: Step 1

trans-unit.source: Look for the Writer module in the palette of datasets and modules on the left of the experiment canvas.
trans-unit.target: Look for the Writer module in the palette of datasets and modules on the left of the experiment canvas.

trans-unit.source: Drag the module to the experiment canvas.
trans-unit.target: Drag the module to the experiment canvas.

trans-unit.source: ![][drag_writer]
trans-unit.target: ![][drag_writer]

trans-unit.source: Step 2
trans-unit.target: Step 2

trans-unit.source: Select the Writer module and fill out the properties pane.
trans-unit.target: Select the Writer module and fill out the properties pane.

trans-unit.source: Select Azure SQL Database as the Data Destination.
trans-unit.target: Select Azure SQL Database as the Data Destination.

trans-unit.source: Database server name: Type the server name.
trans-unit.target: Database server name: Type the server name.

trans-unit.source: You can use the [Azure Portal][] to find this.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [Azure Portal][] to find this.

trans-unit.source: Database name: Type the name of a database on the server you just specified.
trans-unit.target: Database name: Type the name of a database on the server you just specified.

trans-unit.source: Server user account name: Type the user name of an account that has write permissions for the database.
trans-unit.target: Server user account name: Type the user name of an account that has write permissions for the database.

trans-unit.source: Server user account password: Provide the password for the specified user account.
trans-unit.target: Server user account password: Provide the password for the specified user account.

trans-unit.source: Accept any server certificate (insecure): Select this option if you don’t want to view the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Accept any server certificate (insecure): Select this option if you don’t want to view the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Comma-separated list of columns to be saved: Provide a list of the dataset or result columns that you want to output.
trans-unit.target: Comma-separated list of columns to be saved: Provide a list of the dataset or result columns that you want to output.

trans-unit.source: Data table name: Specify the name of the data table.
trans-unit.target: Data table name: Specify the name of the data table.

trans-unit.source: Comma-separated list of datatable columns: Specify the column names to use in the new table.
trans-unit.target: Comma-separated list of datatable columns: Specify the column names to use in the new table.

trans-unit.source: The column names can be different from the ones in the source dataset, but you must list the same number of columns here that you define for the output table.
trans-unit.target: The column names can be different from the ones in the source dataset, but you must list the same number of columns here that you define for the output table.

trans-unit.source: Number of rows written per SQL Azure operation: You can configure the number of rows that are written to a SQL database in one operation.
trans-unit.target: Number of rows written per SQL Azure operation: You can configure the number of rows that are written to a SQL database in one operation.

trans-unit.source: ![][writer_properties]
trans-unit.target: ![][writer_properties]

trans-unit.source: Step 3
trans-unit.target: Step 3

trans-unit.source: Run the experiment by clicking Run under the experiment canvas.
trans-unit.target: Run the experiment by clicking Run under the experiment canvas.

trans-unit.source: When the experiment finishes, all modules will have a green check mark to indicate that they completed successfully.
trans-unit.target: When the experiment finishes, all modules will have a green check mark to indicate that they completed successfully.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: For an overview of integration, see [SQL Data Warehouse integration overview][].
trans-unit.target: For an overview of integration, see [SQL Data Warehouse integration overview][].

trans-unit.source: For more development tips, see [SQL Data Warehouse development overview][].
trans-unit.target: For more development tips, see [SQL Data Warehouse development overview][].
